Problem:
Consider a complex function \\( z: \\mathbb{C} \\rightarrow \\mathbb{C} \\) defined by \\( z(t) = e^{iAt} \\) where \\( A \\) is a real constant matrix and \\( i \\) is the imaginary unit. The function defines wave-like motion in the complex plane over time. An integral transformation \\( T \\) defined by \\( Tz(t) = \\int_0^t e^{iB\\tau} z(\\tau) d\\tau \\) where \\( B \\) is another real constant matrix, is applied to study its effect.

By examining the function at \\( z(T) \\), can we determine if any transformation \\( T \\) was applied during its evolution up to time T?
Explanation: Without explicit information regarding the application of the integral transformation \\( T \\), the observation of \\( z(T) \\) alone does not indicate whether \\( T \\) was applied or not, as \\( T \\) is independent in its application from the standard evolution of \\( z(t) \\).
